Description: THIS EDA AMENDED INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE FULL INFRASTRUCTURE BUILDOUT OF ROSE WAY INDUSTRIAL PARK, THE CONSTRUCTION OF ROSE WAY ROADWAY, AND ONE 23,000 SQUARE FOOT METAL PREFABRICATED BUILDING WITHIN ROSE WAY INDUSTRIAL PARK IN COWLITZ COUNTY, WASHINGTON.  THE PROJECT ALLOWS THE PORT OF WOODLAND TO CREATE MUCH-NEEDED SPACE FOR BUSINESSES IN LIGHT-MANUFACTURING INDUSTRIES AND CREATE ADDITIONAL EMPLOYMENT AND ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES FOR NEARBY COMMUNITIES, WHICH WILL ATTRACT PRIVATE INVESTMENT AND ENHANCE AND DIVERSIFY THE MARKETABILITY OF THE ECONOMY.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE LAKE THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE LAKE PROVIDENCE PORT COMMISSION (LPPC) WITH CONSTRUCTING A THIRD LANE AT THE EXISTING PORT ROAD LOCATED NEAR THE NORTHEASTERN ENTRANCE OF LAKE PROVIDENCE PORT (LPP) IN EAST CARROLL COUNTY, LOUISIANA.  THE THIRD LANE ADDITION WILL PROVIDE A MIDDLE TURN LANE FOR USE BY INBOUND HEAVY TRUCKS AND WILL ALLOW TRAFFIC TO PROCEED WITHOUT DELAY, REDUCE BOTTLENECKS ALONG THE ACCESS ROAD AND MITIGATE POSSIBLE TRAFFIC HAZARDS/ACCIDENTS.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL HELP BOLSTER JOB CREATION, ATTRACT PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND ADVANCE ECONOMIC RESILIENCY THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION OF HARLINGEN, INC. WITH CONSTRUCTING THE 64-ACRE ROOSEVELT INDUSTRIAL PARK IN HARLINGEN, TEXAS.  THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE COMMERCIAL AND COMMUNITY BENEFITS THAT WILL ALLOW NEW BUSINESSES TO INVEST IN THE PARK.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL BOLSTER JOB CREATION, INCREASE PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND STRENGTHEN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE RENOVATION OF ROCK ISLAND ARGENTA DEPOT IN NORTH LITTLE ROCK, ARKANSAS.  THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE ENTREPRENEURIAL TECHNOLOGY CENTER WILL HELP PREPARE STUDENTS FOR IN-DEMAND JOBS AND PROVIDE WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT TRAINING CERTIFICATIONS FOR STUDENTS THROUGHOUT THE REGION.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT ALLOWS FOR THE EXPANSION OF BUSINESS OPERATIONS, WHICH WILL HELP BOLSTER HIGHER PAYING JOBS AND ATTRACT PRIVATE INVESTMENT IN THE AREA.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE CONSTRUCTION OF A MULTI-ENTERPRISE MANUFACTURING FACILITY THAT WILL SUPPORT THE GROWTH OF THE REGION'S MANUFACTURING SECTOR IN AVOYELLES COUNTY, LOUISIANA.  THE PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF THE GARAN BUILDING, AN EXISTING COMMERCIAL SITE LOCATED IN THE CITY OF MARKSVILLE, WHICH WILL HELP FOSTER BUSINESS EXPANSION TO PROVIDE FUTURE REVENUE FOR THE COMMUNITY.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL AIDE IN THE CREATION OF NETWORKING, CONNECTING, AND STRENGTHENING RELATIONSHIPS AMONGST COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS, ENHANCING ECONOMIC GROWTH, PROVIDING COMPETITIVE WAGES TO ALL EMPLOYEES, AND PROVIDING JOB OPPORTUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS PULASKI COUNTY WITH EXTENDING RAIL SERVICE TO SUPPORT MANUFACTURING BUSINESS GROWTH AT THE PORT OF LITTLE ROCK IN ARKANSAS.  THE RELOCATION OF THE EXISTING THIBAULT ROAD WILL HELP SERVE FUTURE MANUFACTURING COMPANIES IN THE AREA.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL BOLSTER JOB CREATION, ATTRACT PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND STRENGTHEN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE CITY OF GREENVILLE WITH MAKING ROADWAY IMPROVEMENTS NEEDED TO EXPAND THE REGION'S CRITICAL AEROSPACE SECTOR IN HUNT, DELTA, HOPKINS AND LAMAR COUNTIES, TEXAS.  THE PROJECT WILL CONSTRUCT A NEW ROADWAY ALIGNMENT FOR THE EXISTING MAJORS ROAD AT GREENVILLE MUNICIPAL AIRPORT - MAJORS FIELD - TO ATTRACT NEW BUSINESSES AND HELP EXISTING BUSINESSES EXPAND THEIR OPERATIONS.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL BOLSTER JOB CREATION, INCREASE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE COMMUNITY, AND RECRUIT NEW INDUSTRIES INTO THE AREA, WHICH WILL ADVANCE ECONOMIC RESILIENCY THROUGHOUT THE REGION AND SPUR PRIVATE INVESTMENT.

THE PROPOSED EDA PROJECT WOULD ASSIST THE PARIS EDA AND THE CITY TO FURTHER DEVELOP THE NW INDUSTRIAL PARK TO HELP MEET BUSINESS DEMANDS. THE CITY AND EDC HAVE THE LAND THAT IS APPEALING FOR CURRENT PROSPECT(S), SURROUNDING BUSINESSES WILL BENEFIT FROM THE INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS, AND THE CITY WILL BENEFIT FROM FUTURE ECONOMIC GROWTH BRINGING NEW BUSINESSES TO THE NW INDUSTRIAL PARK AND THE IMPACT OF THE JOBS AND PRIVATE INVESTMENT WILL BE A MAJOR REVITALIZATION FOR THE AREA THAT HAS BEEN PIVOTING AWAY FROM THE FORMER COTTON INDUSTRY.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE CITY OF LULING WITH MAKING INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS AT THE CITY’S INDUSTRIAL PARK TO SUPPORT BUSINESS GROWTH AND JOB CREATION IN CALDWELL COUNTY, TEXAS.  THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE ROADWAY, WATER, AND BROADBAND IMPROVEMENTS TO SUPPORT BUSINESS EXPANSION IN AEROSPACE MANUFACTURING AND OTHER INDUSTRIES, INCLUDING MEAT AND POULTRY PROCESSING.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE IMPROVEMENTS WILL HELP THE CITY ATTRACT NEW BUSINESS STARTS, PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND SERVE AS A HUB OF ECONOMIC ACTIVITY THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE CITY OF BIG SPRING WITH MAKING WATER AND WASTEWATER INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS AT THE CROSSROADS BUSINESS PARK IN HOWARD COUNTY, TEXAS.  THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE THE NECESSARY UTILITIES TO SUPPORT COMMERCIAL AND INDUSTRIAL BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT AND CREATE JOBS IN THE REGION, WHICH WILL HELP INCREASE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE COMMUNITY, SUPPORT THE FUTURE EXPANSION OF EXISTING COMPANIES, AND RECRUIT NEW INDUSTRIES INTO THE AREA TO ADVANCE ECONOMIC RESILIENCY THROUGHOUT THE REGION AND SPUR PRIVATE INVESTMENT.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE OKMULGEE AREA DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION WITH MAKING INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS AT THE OKMULGEE BUSINESS COMPLEX (OBC) IN OKMULGEE COUNTY, OKLAHOMA.  THE REDEVELOPMENT OF THIS BROWNFIELD WILL HELP ATTRACT MANUFACTURING BUSINESSES AND ENCOURAGE EXPORTS IN THE AREA.  THE OBC IS AN UNFINISHED INDUSTRIAL PARK LOCATED AT US HIGHWAY 75 AND FAIRGROUNDS ROAD IN OKMULGEE.  PROJECT RISE SEEKS TO FINALIZE CONSTRUCTION EFFORTS TO ENSURE THE INFRASTRUCTURE IS VIABLE FOR COMPANY CONSTRUCTION.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL HELP SERVE BUSINESSES AND RESIDENTS IN OKMULGEE AND BEYOND, WHICH WILL PROMOTE FUTURE PRIVATE INVESTMENT AND INDUSTRY EXPANSIONS, BOLSTER JOB CREATION, AND STRENGTHEN RESILIENCY WITHIN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE RENOVATION OF A PRE-ENGINEERED METAL BUILDING FOR USE AS A FOOD INNOVATION AND MANUFACTURING INCUBATOR TO BE OPERATED BY THE LOUISIANA STATE UNIVERSITY AGRICULTURAL CENTER.  THE PROJECT COMPONENTS INCLUDE RENOVATIONS OF APPROXIMATELY 11,130 SQUARE-FEET INTO DRY STORAGE, COOLING AND FREEZING STORAGE, KITCHEN PROCESSING SPACE, ASSORTED STAFF-USE SPACE AS WELL AS A MEZZANINE, AND COVERED LOADING DOCK.  THE INCUBATOR WILL ENABLE THE CENTER TO EXPAND THE SERVICES PROVIDED BY THE FOOD INNOVATION INSTITUTE WHICH BEGAN OPERATIONS IN 2013.  THE INSTITUTE HAS A SUCCESSFUL TRACK RECORD OF LAUNCHING START-UPS, ASSISTING SMALL BUSINESSES, WITH DOCUMENTED ECONOMIC IMPACT TO THE STATE OF LOUISIANA.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL HELP CREATE JOBS, ATTRACT PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND ADVANCE ECONOMIC RESILIENCY THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS SOUTH TEXAS COLLEGE WITH CONSTRUCTING A NEW 20,000 SQUARE FEET FACILITY FOR THE CONTINUING EDUCATION TRAINING PROGRAM THAT WILL BE EFFECTIVELY MANAGED BY SOUTH TEXAS COLLEGE'S DEPARTMENT OF CONTINUING, PROFESSIONAL, AND WORKFORCE EDUCATION IN MCALLEN, TEXAS.  THE FACILITY WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE FAST-TRACK HYBRID HEALTHCARE TRAINING AND LEADING TO CERTIFICATIONS.  THE PROJECT WORK ENTAILS THE SITE WORK, 95,000 SQUARE FEET PARKING LOT AND DRIVE, AND LANDSCAPING ASSOCIATED WITH THE FACILITY.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE GROWTH OF EXISTING BUSINESSES AND INCREASE EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES, WHICH WILL SUPPORT WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT, BOLSTER JOB CREATION, ATTRACT PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND ADVANCE ECONOMIC RESILIENCY THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE TOWN OF GOLDSBY WITH CONSTRUCTING A WASTEWATER INFRASTRUCTURE SYSTEM TO HELP SUPPORT INDUSTRY AND BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT IN MCCLAIN COUNTY, OKLAHOMA.  THE PROJECT INCLUDES BUILDING A SANITARY WASTEWATER COLLECTION SYSTEM THAT WILL ENABLE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT OF THE I-35 CORRIDOR IN THE TOWN FOR BUSINESS, INDUSTRY, AND MEDICAL CARE FACILITIES.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL GENERATE AN ENVIRONMENT THAT CAN SERVE AS A CATALYST FOR UNPRECEDENTED REGIONAL ECONOMIC GROWTH, WHICH WILL SERVE TWO OPPORTUNITY ZONES AND ATTRACT A SIGNIFICANT NUMBER OF BUSINESSES TO THE AREA.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE WESLACO ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION WITH MAKING INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS FOR THE 146-ACRE MID VALLEY INTERNATIONAL INDUSTRIAL PARK IN HIDALGO COUNTY, TEXAS.  THESE IMPROVEMENTS WILL FACILITATE DEVELOPMENT FOR APPROXIMATELY 20-25 COMPANIES TO BUILD FACILITIES FOR COMMERCIAL, INDUSTRIAL, COLD STORAGE AND WAREHOUSING.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL HELP WITH RECOVERY EFFORTS FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC BY CREATING JOBS, INCREASING PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND STRENGTHENING THE REGIONAL ECONOMY.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE CITY OF LAREDO WITH MAKING NEW PUBLIC INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS TO ASSIST IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF INDUSTRIAL AND COMMERCIAL PROPERTIES IN WEBB COUNTY, TEXAS.  THE PROJECT CONSISTS OF CONSTRUCTING A CONCRETE ROADWAY, WATER LINES, SEWER LINES, A REINFORCED CONCRETE PIPE, MULTIPLE BOX CULVERTS, CURB INLETS, ONE JUNCTION BOX, SIDEWALKS, ADA RAMPS, BIKE LINES AND SHARED-USE PATHS.  THE PROJECT WILL HELP THE AREA MITIGATE LOSSES DUE TO THE CLOSING OF SEVERAL SMALL BUSINESSES BY ATTRACTING NEW JOBS AND MORE RESILIENT COMPANIES TO THE REGION, WHICH WILL ATTRACT PRIVATE INVESTMENT AND PROVIDE LONG-TERM SUSTAINABLE ECONOMIC GROWTH.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE DESOTO PARISH POLICE JURY WITH MAKING ROADWAY EXTENSION AND IMPROVEMENTS TO SUPPORT GROWTH AT THE I-49 INDUSTRIAL PARK IN MANSFIELD, LOUISIANA.  THE FREQUENCY OF FLOODS CURRENTLY PREVENTS ACCESS TO THE BUSINESSES WITHIN THE PARK AND ARE BECOMING A HINDRANCE FOR CONDUCTING BUSINESS AND A SAFETY PROBLEM FOR EMPLOYEES AND VENDORS.  THESE IMPROVEMENTS WILL PROVIDE RELIABLE, SAFE INGRESS AND EGRESS TO THE PARK, WHICH WILL HELP GENERATE AN ENVIRONMENT THAT CAN SERVE AS A CATALYST FOR UNPRECEDENTED REGIONAL ECONOMIC GROWTH.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT FUNDS CONSTRUCTION IMPROVEMENTS OF AN EXISTING WASTEWATER SYSTEM FOR THE CITY OF GUYMON, OK.  THESE IMPROVEMENTS WILL SUPPORT THE CITY'S INDUSTRIAL PARK, TO PROVIDE FOR THE NEEDS OF EXISTING BUSINESS, KEEPING THOSE BUSINESSES IN THE PARK, AND ALLOWING FOR SUBSTANTIAL EXPANSION.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL HELP TO GENERATE AN ENVIRONMENT THAT CAN SERVE AS A CATALYST FOR UNPRECEDENTED REGIONAL ECONOMIC GROWTH.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS UNION COUNTY WITH CONSTRUCTING RAILROAD INFRASTRUCTURE AND A CROSS-DOCKING FACILITY TO SERVE THE EL DORADO INDUSTRIAL PARK IN ARKANSAS.  THE PROJECT WILL SUPPORT MANUFACTURING BUSINESSES IN THE AREA AND WOULD AID EFFORTS TO DIVERSIFY THE ECONOMY BY PROVIDING INFRASTRUCTURE TO SUPPORT THE REGIONAL EXPANSION OF THE MANUFACTURING INDUSTRY.  IN ADDITION, THE PROJECT WILL HELP INDUSTRIAL BUSINESSES GROW, WHICH WILL STRENGTHEN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY AND PROVIDE LONG-TERM SUSTAINABLE ECONOMIC GROWTH.

TITLE II SECTION 201 PUBLIC WORKS ASSISTANCE

THE EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE DEVELOPMENT OF WET LAB SPACE AND A CLEAN ROOM IN THE UNIVERSITY OF NEW ORLEANS RESEARCH AND TECHNOLOGY PARK.  THE BIOTECH LABS WILL BE A KEY PART OF THE INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY CENTER LOCATED IN THE UNO RESEARCH AND TECHNOLOGY PARK.  THE PROJECT WILL BE MATCHED BY LOCAL FUNDS AND IS EXPECTED TO CREATE 39 JOBS, RETAIN 19 JOBS AND GENERATE $5 MILLION IN PRIVATE INVESTMENT.

THE REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION'S SOUTHEAST DEVELOPMENT DISTRICT (RPC) OF NEW ORLEANS, LOUISIANA HAS BEEN AN INTEGRAL PART OF THE PROJECT DEVELOPMENT OF THIS EDA INVESTMENT. EDA FUNDS RPC TO BRING TOGETHER THE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SECTORS TO CREATE AN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ROADMAP TO STRENGTHEN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY, SUPPORT PRIVATE CAPITAL INVESTMENT AND CREATE JOBS.

TITLE II, SECTION 201 PUBLIC WORKS ASSISTANCE

THE EDA FUNDS WILL BE USED TO CONSTRUCT INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS TO AID IN THE EXPANSION EFFORTS OF THE CALDWELL INDUSTRIAL PARK.  THE INFRASTRUCTURE INCLUDES ROADWAY, WATER AND SEWER INFRASTRUCTURE TO SUPPORT THE GROWTH OF MANUFACTURING IN THE BRAZOS VALLEY REGION OF TEXAS.  THE CITY OF CALDWELL IS MATCHING THE EDA GRANT WITH LOCAL FUNDS AND THE OVERALL INVESTMENT IS EXPECTED TO CREATE 97 JOBS, RETAIN 73 JOBS, AND GENERATE $8 MILLION IN PRIVATE INVESTMENT.

ADDITIONALLY, THE BRAZOS VALLEY COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (BVCOG) OF BRYAN, TEXAS HAS BEEN AN INTEGRAL PART OF THE PROJECT DEVELOPMENT OF THIS EDA INVESTMENT. EDA FUNDS BVCOG TO BRING TOGETHER THE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SECTORS TO CREATE AN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ROADMAP TO STRENGTHEN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY, SUPPORT PRIVATE CAPITAL INVESTMENT AND CREATE JOBS.

THIS $400,000 EDA INVESTMENT TO FAB LAB TULSA WILL HELP QUIP A NEW FACILITY WITH MODERN DIGITAL FABRICATION EQUIPMENT AND SYSTEMS THAT MATCH INDUSTRY NEEDS. THIS EXPANSION WILL FOCUS ON CLOSING THE SKILLS GAP THAT STUDENTS AND WORKERS MUST HAVE TO REMAIN COMPETITIVE AND EMPLOYABLE. FAB LAB TULSA'S PROGRAMMING WILL DIRECTLY IMPACT THE UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES OF TULSA, DEFINED BY HIGH EMPLOYMENT AND LOW WAGES.  BASED ON THE GRANTEE'S MODELING, THE PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO CREATE 21 JOBS AND LEVERAGE $1,000,000 IN PRIVATE INVESTMENT. 

THIS PROJECT WAS MADE POSSIBLE BY THE REGIONAL PLANNING EFFORTS LED BY THE INDIAN NATIONS COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (INCOG). EDA FUNDS INCOG TO BRING TOGETHER THE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SECTORS TO CREATE AN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ROADMAP TO STRENGTHEN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY, SUPPORT PRIVATE CAPITAL INVESTMENT AND CREATE JOBS.

THIS $2.1 MILLION EDA INVESTMENT TO THE OSAGE NATION WILL ALLOW THE NATION TO FULLY DEVELOP ONE OF ONLY THREE NATION-WIDE NON-MILITARY OWNED UNMANNED AERIAL SYSTEM (UAS) RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT PARKS (ALSO KNOWN AS DRONE PORTS).   THE STRENGTH OF THIS DRONE PORT PROJECT IS SUPPORTED BY EXISTING AIRPARK INFRASTRUCTURE, ITS GEOGRAPHICAL LOCATION, A ROBUST REGIONAL PARTNERSHIP, EXTENSIVE PLANNING, NEWLY EMERGING UAS/UAV MARKET AND PROXIMITY TO A DESIGNATED OPPORTUNITY ZONE.  THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE FACILITIES TO PROVIDE COMMERCIAL TECHNOLOGY DEVELOPERS AN ENVIRONMENT CONDUCIVE TO INNOVATION AND ECONOMIC GROWTH IN THE REGION AND STATE.  

THIS PROJECT WAS MADE POSSIBLE BY THE REGIONAL PLANNING EFFORTS LED BY THE INDIAN NATIONS COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (INCOG). EDA FUNDS INCOG TO BRING TOGETHER THE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SECTORS TO CREATE AN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ROADMAP TO STRENGTHEN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY, SUPPORT PRIVATE CAPITAL INVESTMENT AND CREATE JOBS.

THE $1,460,000 EDA INVESTMENT WILL HELP THE CITY OF CROSSETT COMPLETE THE "EAST CROSSETT SEWER IMPROVEMENT PROJECT."  RECENTLY, CROSSETT'S LARGEST EMPLOYER ANNOUNCED LAYOFFS OF NEARLY 600 EMPLOYEES. SHORTLY AFTER, THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC HIT AND CHANGED THE WAY EVERYONE CONDUCTED BUSINESS OVERNIGHT. THIS PROJECT WILL HELP THE COMMUNITY RECOVER FROM THESE TWO ECONOMIC DISLOCATIONS AND IS CALCULATED TO CREATE 220 JOBS, RETAIN 40, LEVERAGE $603,000,000 IN PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND BENEFIT THE CROSSETT INDUSTRIAL PARK, WHICH HIS LOCATED IN AN OPPORTUNITY ZONE.

THIS PROJECT WAS MADE POSSIBLE BY THE REGIONAL PLANNING EFFORTS LED BY THE SOUTHEAST ARKANSAS ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT DISTRICT (SEAPDD). EDA FUNDS SEAPDD TO BRING TOGETHER THE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SECTORS TO CREATE AN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ROADMAP TO STRENGTHEN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY, SUPPORT PRIVATE CAPITAL INVESTMENT AND CREATE JOBS.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT WILL ALLOW THE FAIRFIELD ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION (FEDC) TO MAKE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE OLD MEXIA-FAIRFIELD ROAD TO FACILITATE JOB CREATION AND PRIVATE INVESTMENT IN A NEW INDUSTRIAL PARK. THE PROJECT WILL HELP THE CITY TO DIVERSIFY ITS ECONOMY AND BECOME MORE RESILIENT TO ECONOMIC CYCLES.  IT WILL ALSO DIRECTLY HELP THE CITY TO REBOUND FROM THE CLOSURE OF THE BIG BROWN POWER PLANT AND BIG BROWN COAL MINE IN 2018. THE PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO CREATE 14 JOBS AND LEVERAGE $9 MILLION IN PRIVATE INVESTMENT.

THIS PROJECT WAS MADE POSSIBLE BY THE REGIONAL PLANNING EFFORTS LED BY THE HEART OF TEXAS COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (HOTCOG). EDA FUNDS HOTCOG TO BRING TOGETHER THE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SECTORS TO CREATE AN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ROADMAP TO STRENGTHEN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY, SUPPORT PRIVATE CAPITAL INVESTMENT AND CREATE JOBS.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT WILL ALLOW THE CITY OF CLEBURNE UNDERTAKE ROADWAY CONSTRUCTION, CONNECTING TWO EXISTING SEGMENTS OF SPARKS DRIVE, PROVIDING INDUSTRIAL COMPANIES IN AN ECONOMICALLY DISTRESSED PART OF THE CITY WITH IMPROVED ACCESS TO A MAJOR HIGHWAY. THE IMPROVED ACCESS AND ADDITIONAL ROAD CAPACITY IS EXPECTED TO FACILITATE JOB RETENTION AND THE CREATION OF NEW JOBS BY ACCOMMODATING INCREASED TRUCK TRAFFIC AND REDUCING TRANSPORTATION TIMES. THE GRANTEE ESTIMATES THAT THE PROJECT WILL RESULT IN 300 NEW JOBS AND $60 MILLION IN PRIVATE INVESTMENT.

THIS PROJECT WAS MADE POSSIBLE BY THE REGIONAL PLANNING EFFORTS LED BY THE HEART OF TEXAS COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (HOTCOG). EDA FUNDS HOTCOG TO BRING TOGETHER THE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SECTORS TO CREATE AN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ROADMAP TO STRENGTHEN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY, SUPPORT PRIVATE CAPITAL INVESTMENT AND CREATE JOBS.

THIS EDA AMENDED INVESTMENT FUNDS CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS AT NEW MEXICO STATE UNIVERSITY'S (NMSU) ARROWHEAD PARK, TO ATTRACT BUSINESS IN THE MEDIA, HEALTHCARE, AND AEROSPACE INDUSTRY CLUSTER IN DONA ANA COUNTY, NEW MEXICO, A DESIGNATED OPPORTUNITY ZONE.  THE PROJECT WILL BUILD UPON PAST SUCCESSES AT NMSU'S ARROWHEAD PARK BY CONSTRUCTING NEW ROADS AND A SEWER INFRASTRUCTURE THAT WILL SUPPORT THE OPENING OF NEW BUSINESSES.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL CREATE JOBS, ATTRACT PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND ADVANCE ECONOMIC GROWTH THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE RENOVATION AND EXPANSION OF THE 500 SAILS BOATYARD IN THE COMMONWEALTH OF NORTHERN MARIANA ISLANDS (CNMI).  THE PROJECT WILL TRANSFORM THE BUILDING FROM A SMALL TEACHING BOATYARD TO A MODERN MARITIME TRAINING FACILITY (MTC).  THE NORTHERN MARIANA ISLANDS MARITIME TRAINING CENTER WILL PROVIDE FORMAL, HANDS-ON TRAINING TO A GROWING WORKFORCE FOR CNMI'S EMERGING MARITIME INDUSTRY.  THE MARITIME INDUSTRY WILL BRING DIVERSITY TO THE CNMI'S ECONOMY THAT IS CURRENTLY DOMINATED BY ONE INDUSTRY, TOURISM.  THE MTC WILL HELP THE CNMI COMMUNITIES ACCELERATE ECONOMIC RECOVERY FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC AND BUILD AN ECONOMY THAT WILL BE RESILIENT TO FUTURE ECONOMIC SHOCKS, WHICH WILL HELP BOOST THE MARITIME WORKFORCE THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE FORT MOJAVE AHA MACAV POWER SERVICE WITH DEVELOPING A NEW SOURCE OF CLEAN AND RENEWABLE ENERGY FOR THE FORT MOJAVE RESERVATION THROUGH THE CONSTRUCTION OF A 2.3-MEGAWATT SOLAR POWER SYSTEM.  THE PROJECT WILL HELP WITH INFRASTRUCTURE, SUSTAINABLE REVENUE, AND INCREASE JOB CREATION THAT WILL BENEFIT THE RESERVATION IN MOHAVE COUNTY, ARIZONA.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL PRODUCE AFFORDABLE ELECTRICITY, ATTRACT PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND PROMOTE ECONOMIC GROWTH AND RESILIENCY ON THE RESERVATION.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS KLICKITAT COUNTY AND THE CITY OF THE DALLES WITH CONSTRUCTING AN AVIATION WORKFORCE TRAINING CENTER IN GOLDENDALE, WASHINGTON.  THE PROJECT WILL SUPPORT INFRASTRUCTURE THAT WILL PREPARE STUDENTS FOR IN-DEMAND, HIGH-WAGE JOBS IN AVIATION MAINTENANCE.  THE PROJECT WILL CONSIST OF CONSTRUCTING THE AVIATION WORKFORCE TRAINING HANGER ALONGSIDE EXISTING STRUCTURES THAT INCLUDE A FORMER RUNWAY, OTHER HANGERS, AN OPERATION CENTER, RESTAURANT, NAVIGATION FACILITY, AND LIFE FLIGHT FACILITIES.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL CREATE HIGH PAYING JOBS, SAVE JOBS, SPUR PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND ADVANCE ECONOMIC RESILIENCY IN THE REGION.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS TILLAMOOK BAY COMMUNITY COLLEGE (TBCC) WITH ESTABLISHING THE TBCC WRITE THE FUTURE PROJECT, TO PROVIDE CAPACITY TO SERVE THE GROWING WORKFORCE NEEDS IN MANUFACTURING AND INDUSTRIAL TECHNOLOGY, WELDING TECHNOLOGY, AND AGRICULTURAL TECHNOLOGY IN TILLAMOOK, OREGON.  THE COLLEGE WILL REMODEL A FACILITY TO PROVIDE TWO INSTRUCTIONAL CLASSROOMS, LAB, OFFICE SPACE, STORAGE SPACE FOR MATERIALS AND EQUIPMENT, AND ALLOW FOR EXPANSION OF PROGRAMS IN THE FUTURE.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL HELP ADDRESS THE SEVERE IMPACTS OF COVID-19 ON THE COUNTY BY CREATING AND RETAINING JOBS, INCREASING PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND ADVANCING ECONOMIC RESILIENCY THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE INLAND VALLEY DEVELOPMENT AGENCY AND THE SAN MANUEL BAND OF MISSION INDIANS WITH CONSTRUCTING ROADWAY IMPROVEMENTS TO STERLING AVENUE IN SAN BERNARDINO COUNTY, CALIFORNIA.  THE PROJECT WILL CONNECT STERLING AVENUE THROUGH 3RD STREET AND INTO PERIMETER ROAD TO ENHANCE ACCESS AND CIRCULATION FOR THE SAN BERNARDINO INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT AND SURROUNDING AREAS.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL BOLSTER JOB CREATION, INCREASE PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND STRENGTHEN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE CITY OF MURRIETA WITH RENOVATING THE EXISTING MURRIETA INNOVATION CENTER (MIC) INTO A TOP-NOTCH LIFE SCIENCE STARTUP INCUBATOR THAT WILL BE THE PREMIER BUSINESS INCUBATOR AND A DRIVER FOR JOB CREATION IN THE SOUTHWEST RIVERSIDE COUNTY REGION OF CALIFORNIA.  THE FACILITY WILL FEATURE A WET LAB, CREATIVE OFFICE SPACE, A LEARNING CENTER, SMALL BUSINESS SUPPORT SERVICES, AND MEDICAL CONFERENCE ROOM. THESE IMPROVEMENTS WILL STRENGTHEN THE MIC'S ROLE AS A REGIONAL INNOVATION HUB THAT CAN BRING ENTREPRENEURS, START-UPS, ESTABLISHED COMPANIES, UNIVERSITIES, STUDENTS, CONSULTANTS, AND NON-PROFITS TOGETHER WITH TECHNOLOGY AND RESOURCES TO GENERATE AN ENVIRONMENT THAT CAN SERVE AS A CATALYST FOR UNPRECEDENTED REGIONAL ECONOMIC GROWTH.

THIS EDA AMENDED INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF EKWOK WITH CONSTRUCTING THE GREEN BUILDING TO STORE SUPPLIES IN DILLINGHAM COUNTY, ALASKA.  THE PROJECT INCLUDES A HEATED AND COVERED S-1 MODERATE HAZARD STORAGE FACILITY FOR EMERGENCY SUPPLIES, RECYCLABLE MATERIALS, AND REGULATED MATERIALS THAT CANNOT BE DISCARDED IN THE LOCAL LANDFILL.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL INCREASE RESILIENCY OF THE EKWOK TRIBAL VILLAGE BY ALLOWING FOR A PROPER INFRASTRUCTURE TO DISPOSE OF RECYCLABLE AND HAZARDOUS MATERIALS, WHICH WILL HELP WITH RECOVERY EFFORTS FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, CREATE AND RETAIN JOBS, INCREASE PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND STRENGTHEN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY.

THIS EDA AMENDED INVESTMENT PROVIDES SUFFICIENT ADDITIONAL FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE CONSTRUCTION OF A GAS STATION AND CONVENIENCE STORE ON THE ELK VALLEY RANCHERIA RESERVATION LAND, KNOWN AS THE 'MARTIN RANCH' IN CRESCENT CITY, CALIFORNIA, A DESIGNATED OPPORTUNITY ZONE.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL IMPROVE THE REGIONS SOCIOECONOMIC STATUS, INCREASE EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS, AND ADVANCE ECONOMIC RESILIENCY THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

THIS PROJECT IS LOCATED IN CRESCENT CITY, CA AND WILL CONSTRUCT A GAS STATION AND CONVENIENCE STORE ON ELK VALLEY RANCHERIA RESERVATION LAND, KNOWN AS THE "MARTIN RANCH"

THIS SMALL, RURAL REGION IS ISOLATED FROM THE ECONOMIC CENTERS OF URBAN CALIFORNIA, SHIELDED BETWEEN THE MASSIVE CURTAIN OF THE OLD GROWTH REDWOOD FORESTS AND THE PACIFIC OCEAN. WITH A COUNTY POPULATION OF APPROXIMATELY 28,000, IT IS HOME TO SOME OF THE HIGHEST INDICATORS OF POVERTY IN THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA.

THE TRIBE IS GEOGRAPHICALLY ISOLATED FROM MAJOR POPULATION CENTERS AND THEREFORE FACES OBSTACLES IN DISCOVERING ECONOMIC VENTURES THAT FIT WELL INTO THE OVERALL REGION. 

THE OVERALL GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CONSTRUCT AN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT PROJECT THAT WILL SERVE TO:
- PROVIDE INCREASED EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS.
- IMPROVE THE SOCIOECONOMIC STATUS OF THE TRIBE.
- INCREASE FUNDING FOR A VARIETY OF SOCIAL, GOVERNMENTAL, ADMINISTRATIVE, EDUCATIONAL, HEALTH AND WELFARE SERVICES TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR TRIBAL MEMBERS.
- PROVIDE REVENUE TO RESTORE THE LOST LAND BASE AND TO PROVIDE CAPITAL FOR OTHER ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES.
- PROVIDE FOR ECONOMIC SELF-SUFFICIENCY.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE CITY OF ANACORTES WITH THE INSTALLATION OF A CITY-WIDE FIBER OPTIC BROADBAND NETWORK TO PROVIDE A MORE COMPLETE COVERAGE IN SKAGIT COUNTY, WASHINGTON, A DESIGNATED OPPORTUNITY ZONE.  THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE BROADBAND SERVICE OPTIONS TO ISLAND HOSPITAL IN ANACORTES, WHICH ENHANCES THE MEDICAL COMMUNITY'S ABILITY TO SERVE PATIENTS LOCALLY THROUGH THE USE OF VIDEO CONFERENCING AND CONSULTATION WITH LARGER HOSPITALS. ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL HELP RESTART THE LOCAL ECONOMY AFTER THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC AND MITIGATE LOSSES IN THE EVENT OF OTHER ECONOMIC DISRUPTIONS, WHICH WILL HELP THE REGION OVERCOME THE LACK OF ADEQUATE, RELIABLE BROADBAND SERVICE TO HELP DIVERSIFY AND STRENGTHEN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE RENOVATION OF COLLEGE HALLS AT THE SOUTHWESTERN OREGON COMMUNITY COLLEGE FOR INSTRUCTION IN THE GROWING SOUTHWEST OREGON OCCUPATIONS OF DENTAL ASSISTANCE, FIRE SCIENCE, FORESTRY/NATURAL RESOURCES, CRIMINAL JUSTICE AND COMPUTER SCIENCE/CYBERSECURITY.  THE PROJECT WILL MODERNIZE 35-YEAR-OLD-PLUS LABS, CLASSROOMS, AND LECTURE SPACE TO SUPPORT AND REVITALIZE THE COLLEGE'S CAREER AND TECHNICAL EDUCATION PROGRAMS.

THE CITY OF TWENTYNINE PALMS SEEKS TO CONSTRUCT A WASTEWATER PACKAGE TREATMENT PLANT IN ORDER TO ADDRESS SUBSTANTIAL WASTEWATER INFRASTRUCTURE NEEDS THAT WILL ENHANCE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR LOCAL RESIDENTS AND OUTSIDE INVESTORS.

THE SCOPE OF WORK FOR THIS PROJECT INCLUDES TWO PRIMARY COMPONENTS: THE PACKAGE TREATMENT PLANT CONSTRUCTION AND GROUNDWATER WELL CONSTRUCTION. PRELIMINARY DESIGN AND PLANNING WORK IS ALREADY UNDERWAY AND ANTICIPATED TO BE COMPLETED BY DECEMBER 2020. SINCE THE ENGINEERING WORK HAS ALREADY COMMENCED, ALL EXPENSES RELATED TO THAT PROCESS WILL BE COVERED BY THE CITY OF TWENTYINE PALMS. PACKAGE TREATMENT PLANT CONSTRUCTION:
INSTALLATION OF AN ONSITE PACKAGE TREATMENT PLANT
INSTALLATION OF THREE GROUNDWATER MONITORING WELLS
GROUNDWATER WELL CONSTRUCTION:
GROUNDWATER MONITORING WELL INSTALLATION
WELL SURVEY
WELL DEVELOPMENT
INVESTIGATION DERIVED WASTES
WELL INSTALLATION REPORT
.

AN EDA GRANT WOULD SUPPORT THE CONSTRUCTION OF A METAL PRE-FABRICATED BUILDING TO PROVIDE INDUSTRIAL WORK SPACE FOR USE BY MANUFACTURING FIRMS IN WASHOUGAL, WASHINGTON. THE PROJECT WILL DEVELOP INFRASTRUCTURE THAT WILL FACILITATE THE EXPANSION OF BUSINESS ENTERPRISES IN THE REGION. THE EXPANDED BUSINESS OPERATIONS OF THE FIRMS WILL CONTRIBUTE TO MORE EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE REGION'S WORKFORCE. THE PROJECT WORK WILL INVOLVE CLARK COUNTY, WHICH IS LOCATED IN THE SOUTHWESTERN PART OF WASHINGTON STATE.

THIS EDA AMENDMENT SUPPORTS THE UNLV RESEARCH FOUNDATION WITH PHASE II OF THE INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS OF ROADWAYS TO SERVE THE HARRY REID RESEARCH AND TECHNOLOGY PARK, A DESIGNATED OPPORTUNITY ZONE IN LAS VEGAS, NEVADA PROJECT.  BY ADDING STORMWATER DRAINAGE AND EXPANDING ROADS, THE PROJECT WILL HELP ADVANCE BUSINESS INNOVATION AND ENTREPRENEURIAL ACTIVITY, WHICH WILL LEAD TO THE CREATION OF JOBS AND DIVERSIFICATION OF THE LOCAL ECONOMY.

THE PROJECT IS LOCATED IN KAKE, WITHIN THE HYDER CENSUS AREA OF ALASKA'S UNORGANIZED BOROUGH. DATA SHOWS THAT THE PER CAPITA INCOME FOR KAKE, AK IS 61% OF THE US NATIONAL AVERAGE AND THE UNEMPLOYMENT RATE IS 28%, WHICH IS 278% ABOVE THE US NATIONAL AVERAGE. THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS KAKE'S GROWING VISITOR/CULTURAL TOURISM INDUSTRIES. REUSE OF THE KAKE CANNERY, A NATIONAL HISTORIC LANDMARK, WILL ADDRESS THE PROBLEM OF HIGH UNEMPLOYMENT BY PROVIDING A SPACE WHERE THE TRIBAL MEMBERS CAN SHOWCASE AND SELL THEIR CULTURAL ARTS, CRAFTS, AND FOOD FOR SALE TO VISITORS. THIS IS ANTICIPATED TO LEAD TO THE CREATION OF ROUGHLY 189 JOBS. THE PROJECT INVOLVES PROVIDING THE NECESSARY MECHANICAL, PUBLIC SAFETY, AND RELATED INFRASTRUCTURE, WATER AND SEWER CONNECTIONS, 2 RESTROOM FACIILITIES AND A COMMERCIAL KITCHEN IN THE EXISTING KAKE HISTORIC CANNERY.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT FUNDS THE CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW BUILDING TO HOUSE AGRICULTURAL PRODUCE PROCESSING AND A FARMER TRAINING FACILITY IN WAIANAE, HAWAII.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL DEVELOP INFRASTRUCTURE TO IMPROVE ECONOMIC CAPACITY AND ASSETS THAT MAKE IT POSSIBLE FOR ENTREPRENEURS AND SMALL BUSINESS ENTERPRISES TO BE MORE OPERATIONALLY EFFICIENT, WHICH WILL RESULT IN NEW HIGHER PAYING JOBS AND ADDITIONAL EMPLOYMENT THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE TOWN OF OXFORD WITH MAKING WATER INFRASTRUCTURE UPGRADES TO SUPPORT MANUFACTURING IN BENTON COUNTY, INDIANA.  THE PROJECT WILL INCREASE CAPACITY AND RELIABILITY OF WATER SERVICE TO MEET THE INCREASED NEEDS OF A LOCAL PHARMACEUTICAL MANUFACTURER.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL HELP STRENGTHEN THE LOCAL ECONOMY, SAVE JOBS THROUGHOUT THE REGION, AND LEAD TO LONG-TERM ECONOMIC GROWTH.

THIS EDA PUBLIC WORKS AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ASSISTANCE AWARD WILL HELP THE CITY OF JASPER CONSTRUCT A NEW BACKUP WATER SUPPLY CONNECTION TO SUPPORT INDUSTRIAL USERS, WHO RELY ON A STEADY SUPPLY OF WATER TO MAINTAIN OPERATIONS. THE MULTI-COUNTY REGION THAT INCLUDES JASPER SUFFERS FROM LOW PER CAPITA INCOME, AND THE CITY'S STRONG WOOD PRODUCTS MANUFACTURING CLUSTER IS A SOURCE OF HIGH-QUALITY JOB GROWTH. CITY LEADERS RECOGNIZE THE NEED FOR WATER SYSTEM IMPROVEMENTS TO ALLOW MANUFACTURERS SERVED BY THE SYSTEM TO CONTINUE TO EXPAND. EDA-FUNDED IMPROVEMENTS INCLUDE A NEW METER PIT AND WATER LINE THAT WILL CONNECT TO THE MAIN PATOKA LAKE REGIONAL WATER & SEWER DISTRICT SYSTEM. THE PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO RESULT IN 225 NEW JOBS AND $34 MILLION IN PRIVATE INVESTMENT IN THE REGION.

THIS EDA PUBLIC WORKS AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT FACILITIES AWARD WILL HELP MAHONING COUNTY CONSTRUCT UPGRADES TO THE MAHONING AVENUE INDUSTRIAL CORRIDOR. IN RECENT YEARS THE MAHONING COUNTY REGION SUFFERED MULTIPLE PLANT CLOSURES, INCLUDING COAL-RELATED CLOSURES, AND CURRENTLY HAS A HIGH UNEMPLOYMENT RATE. AS A CENTER OF INDUSTRIAL ACTIVITY IN THE REGION, THE MAHONING AVENUE INDUSTRIAL CORRIDOR IS A SOURCE OF HIGH-QUALITY JOBS WITH A POTENTIAL FOR FUTURE JOB GROWTH AND PRIVATE INVESTMENT. THE EDA-FUNDED INFRASTRUCTURE UPGRADES INCLUDE ROADWAY AND DRAINAGE IMPROVEMENTS, BRIDGE REPLACEMENT, AND RESURFACING. THE UPGRADED INFRASTRUCTURE WILL MAKE THIS CRITICAL CORRIDOR AN ATTRACTIVE LOCATION FOR JOB GROWTH AND WILL GIVE EXISTING EMPLOYERS CONFIDENCE IN THE REGION'S ABILITY TO PROVIDE SERVICES THAT EMPLOYERS REQUIRE TO EXPAND. THE PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO HELP CREATE 75 JOBS AND GENERATE $5 MILLION IN PRIVATE INVESTMENT.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS BELMONT COLLEGE WITH CONSTRUCTING A NEW CONSTRUCTION TRADES BUILDING, TO HOUSE THE COLLEGE'S HVAC AND BUILDING PRESERVATION AND REPAIR PROGRAMS IN ST. CLAIRSVILLE, OHIO.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL HELP THE REGION WITH RECOVERY EFFORTS FROM THE DECLINE OF THE COAL INDUSTRY AND THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC BY DIVERSIFYING THE REGIONAL ECONOMY, ENHANCING JOB CREATION, AND ATTRACTING PRIVATE INVESTMENT, WHICH WILL HELP STRENGTHEN AND ADVANCE ECONOMIC RESILIENCY THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE RIVER RIDGE DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY WITH CONSTRUCTING NEARLY 12,000 FEET OF WATER MAIN TO CONNECT WATER STORAGE TANKS AND INCREASE THE RIVER RIDGE DEVELOPMENT PARK'S WATER CAPACITY IN CLARK, INDIANA.  THE REGION SUFFERED LAYOFFS AND BUSINESS CLOSURES AS A RESULT OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, AND THE DUKE ENERGY GALLAGHER COAL-FIRED POWER PLANT CLOSURE IN 2021 FURTHER EXACERBATED THE REGION'S DISTRESS.  THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE NEW OPPORTUNITIES FOR DISPLACED COAL WORKERS AND HELP DIVERSIFY THE REGION'S ECONOMY TO BECOME MORE RESILIENT IN THE FUTURE, WHICH WILL SERVE AS A CATALYST FOR UNPRECEDENTED REGIONAL ECONOMIC GROWTH.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE JOHN A. LOGAN COLLEGE WITH CONSTRUCTING A NEW CAREER AND TECHNICAL CENTER (CTC) TO SPUR WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT IN CRITICAL AND IN-DEMAND INDUSTRIES IN THE WILLIAMSON COUNTY, ILLINOIS REGION.  WHILE THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC DEVASTATED LOCAL BUSINESSES AND LED TO HIGHER UNEMPLOYMENT AND BUSINESS CLOSURES, THE PANDEMIC ALSO CREATED DEMAND FOR WORKER RETRAINING IN GROWING REGIONAL INDUSTRIES INCLUDING ADVANCED MANUFACTURING.  AS A RESULT, LOCAL LEADERS AND THE COLLEGE DETERMINED THAT NEW CAREER TRAINING PROGRAMS IN WELDING AND COMPUTER NUMERICALLY CONTROLLED (CNC) OPERATION WOULD HELP FILL LOCAL BUSINESSES' DEMAND FOR SKILLED WORKERS AS THE PANDEMIC RECEDES.  THE NEW CTC WILL INCLUDE CLASSROOM AND DEMONSTRATION SPACE FOR TRAINING IN A VARIETY OF FIELDS INCLUDING ADVANCED MANUFACTURING AND RELATED SKILLS AND TECHNOLOGIES.  THE NEW PROGRAMS WILL ENSURE THAT THE REGIONAL WORKFORCE HAS THE SKILLS TO MEET EMPLOYERS' NEEDS, WHICH WILL HELP BOLSTER JOB CREATION, INCREASE PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND STRENGTHEN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS ATHENS COUNTY PORT AUTHORITY WITH CONSTRUCTING A NEW BUILDING TO ACCOMMODATE THE EXPANSION PLANS OF LOCAL BIO-TECHNOLOGY COMPANIES CURRENTLY LOCATED AT THE NEARBY OHIO UNIVERSITY INNOVATION CENTER IN ATHENS, OHIO.  ATHENS COUNTY SUFFERS FROM LONG-TERM ECONOMIC DISTRESS RELATED TO THE DECLINE IN COAL MANUFACTURING IN THE REGION.  THE CORONAVIRUS PANDEMIC'S IMPACTS EXACERBATED THE REGION'S DISTRESS AND CAUSED SIGNIFICANT JOB LOSSES AND BUSINESS CLOSURES.  THE BUILDING WILL CREATE A SPACE FOR LOCALLY-GROWN BUSINESSES TO EXPAND AND CREATE NEW JOBS, AND IT WILL BE AN ASSET FOR THE REGION'S ONGOING RECOVERY AND RESILIENCE TO FUTURE ECONOMIC SHOCKS.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL HELP THE REGION CONTINUE TO DIVERSIFY ITS INDUSTRIES AND PLAY A VITAL ROLE IN THE ECONOMIC WELLBEING OF THE LOCAL COMMUNITY, TO SERVE AS A CATALYST FOR UNPRECEDENTED REGIONAL ECONOMIC GROWTH.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE CITY OF WEST BRANCH WITH CONSTRUCTING A WATER TREATMENT PLANT AND NEW WELL TO INCREASE WATER CAPACITY AND ADDRESS WATER QUALITY ISSUES AFFECTING THE REGION'S BUSINESSES AND RESIDENTS IN OGEMAW COUNTY, MICHIGAN.  THE PROJECT WILL EXPAND THE WATER SYSTEM AND HELP ENSURE THAT INDUSTRIAL USERS HAVE THE WATER CAPACITY NEEDED TO REMAIN COMPETITIVE.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL HELP THE REGION ATTRACT NEW EMPLOYERS, BOLSTER JOB CREATION, SPUR PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND ADVANCE ECONOMIC RESILIENCY THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT WILL SUPPORT THE CHIBARDUN TELEPHONE COOPERATIVE INSTALL MORE THAN 70 MILES OF BROADBAND FIBER-OPTIC CABLE IN WISCONSIN'S BARRON AND WASHBURN COUNTIES. THROUGHOUT THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, BUSINESSES IN NORTHERN WISCONSIN RELIED ON BROADBAND CONNECTIVITY TO ENSURE CONTINUOUS BUSINESS OPERATIONS, AND BUSINESSES THAT LACKED BROADBAND CAPACITY STRUGGLED TO OPERATE. THE EDA-FUNDED BROADBAND LINE WILL BE THE BACKBONE OF FUTURE EXPANSIONS CHIBARDUN INTENDS TO UNDERTAKE TO BRING BROADBAND ACCESS TO MORE USERS AND ENHANCE THE ECONOMIC CONDITIONS AND ATTRACTIVENESS OF THE TWO COUNTIES TO BUSINESSES. THE LINE WILL ALSO PROVIDE FIBER REDUNDANCY TO IMPROVE THE SYSTEM'S RELIABILITY AND RESILIENCE IN THE FACE OF FUTURE NATURAL DISASTERS AND OTHER DISRUPTIONS. WITH THE DEMONSTRATED SUPPORT OF MANY LOCAL BUSINESSES THE GRANTEE ESTIMATES THAT THE PROJECT WILL HELP CREATE MORE THAN 50 NEW JOBS AND WILL HELP THE REGION RETAIN MORE THAN 600 EXISTING JOBS.

THIS EDA AWARD TO THE CITY OF GRAND RAPIDS WILL HELP THE CITY EXPAND ITS INDUSTRIAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND PREPARE NEW DEVELOPABLE INDUSTRIAL ACREAGE TO HELP THE CITY TO EMBRACE DIVERSE NEW EMPLOYERS AND PROVIDE SPACE FOR EXISTING EMPLOYERS TO EXPAND. JOB LOSSES FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC SHOWED THE CITY THE NEED TO DIVERSIFY ITS EMPLOYER-BASE TO ENSURE RESILIENCY IN THE FACE OF FUTURE ECONOMIC AND NATURAL DISASTERS. THE ADDITIONAL EDA-FUNDED INFRASTRUCTURE WILL PROVIDE THE CITY WITH AMPLE NEW DEVELOPABLE SPACE THAT THE CITY HOPES TO USE TO ATTRACT NEW BUSINESSES AND GROW EXISTING BUSINESSES.

THIS EDA AWARD TO THE STARKE COUNTY INITIATIVE FOR LIFELONG LEARNING (SCILL) WILL HELP CONSTRUCT A NEW 12,000 SQUARE FOOT WORKFORCE TRAINING CENTER TO BE UTILIZED FOR PRECISION WELDING, AUTOMATION, ROBOTICS, AND EQUIPMENT MAINTENANCE PROGRAMS. AS A RESULT OF CHANGING WORKFORCE PATTERNS ACCELERATED BY THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, THE GRANTEE SAW INCREASED DEMAND FOR WORKFORCE TRAINING AND EXPECTS TO DOUBLE THE NUMBER OF ADULT STUDENTS TRAINED PER YEAR. THE NEW EDA-FUNDED FACILITY WILL HELP UNIFY THE GRANTEE'S TRAINING PROGRAMS ON ONE CAMPUS AND PROVIDE A CENTRAL LOCATION WITH STATE-OF-THE-ART EQUIPMENT AND RESOURCES TO EXPAND CRITICAL WORKFORCE TRAINING PROGRAMS IN THE REGION.

THIS EDA AWARD WILL HELP THE VILLAGE OF GRANTSBURG EXPAND ITS NORTH INDUSTRIAL PARK. IN ADDITION TO LONG-TERM DISTRESS, THE REGION WAS HIT WITH FLOOD DISASTERS IN 2017 AND AGAIN IN 2019 AS WELL AS THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. EACH OF THE DISASTERS IMPACTED THE REGION'S CRITICAL TOURISM INDUSTRY. AS A RESULT OF DISRUPTIONS TO THE TOURISM SECTOR, LOCAL LEADERS FOCUSED ON PROVIDING EXPANDED INFRASTRUCTURE TO ATTRACT AND RETAIN INDUSTRIAL ENTITIES AND THE HIGH-SKILL JOBS ASSOCIATED WITH THEM. THE EDA-FUNDED EXPANSION WILL PROVIDE THE CITY WITH AN ADDITIONAL 26 ACRES OF DEVELOPABLE SPACE WHERE NEW AND EXISTING BUSINESSES CAN EXPAND AND LOCATE. THE PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO CREATE NEARLY 400 JOBS AND GENERATE $83 MILLION IN PRIVATE INVESTMENT.

THIS EDA AWARD WILL SUPPORT THE TOWN OF AVILLA'S INDUSTRIAL PARK EXPANSION PROJECT. LOCATED NEAR FORT WAYNE, THE TOWN HAS STRONG REGIONAL TRANSPORTATION ASSETS THAT HAVE ATTRACTED AN EMERGING TRANSPORTATION, DISTRIBUTION, AND LOGISTICS (TDL) CLUSTER. AS A RESULT OF THE TOWN'S TRACK RECORD OF GROWTH, THE EXISTING INDUSTRIAL PARK IS AT CAPACITY, LIMITING THE REGION'S ABILITY TO CAPITALIZE ON TDL EXPANSION RESULTING FROM CHANGES WROUGHT BY THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE 81-ACRE EDA-FUNDED INDUSTRIAL PARK EXPANSION WILL PROVIDE THE TOWN WITH A CRITICAL ASSET TO MAINTAIN ITS COMPETITIVENESS AS A REGIONAL HUB FOR TDL OPERATIONS. THE PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO HELP CREATE MORE THAN 70 JOBS AND GENERATE $7.7 MILLION IN PRIVATE INVESTMENT.

THIS EDA AWARD WILL HELP THE CITY OF DETROIT CONSTRUCT CRITICAL ROAD INFRASTRUCTURE TO SUPPORT INCREASED PRODUCTION AT THE GENERAL MOTORS DETROIT-HAMTRAMCK PLANT. GM PLANS TO INVEST $800 MILLION IN SUPPLIER TOOLING RELATED TO THE LAUNCH OF THE COMPANY'S NEW ELECTRIC TRUCKS. WHEN THE PLANT IS FULLY OPERATIONAL, IT WILL PROVIDE 2,200 HIGH-SKILL MANUFACTURING JOBS IN THE CITY. TO SUPPORT THE PLANT'S INCREASED PRODUCTION, NEARBY ROADS MUST BE UPGRADED TO ACCOMMODATE ADDITIONAL TRAFFIC RELATED TO THE FACILITY. THIS EDA-FUNDED INFRASTRUCTURE WILL PROVIDE CRITICAL ACCESS ROADS TO THE PLANT AND ENHANCE DIRECT ACCESS TO THE I-94 INDUSTRIAL CORRIDOR. IN ADDITION TO THE AUTOMOTIVE SUPPLY CHAIN, THIS INFRASTRUCTURE WILL BE AN ASSET TO THE MULTITUDE OF INDUSTRIAL MANUFACTURERS IN THE DETROIT REGION, WHO RELY ON THE MT. ELLIOTT CORRIDOR AND EAST GRAND BOULEVARD FOR CRITICAL ACCESS TO I-94.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS PUEBLO COMMUNITY COLLEGE (PCC) WITH REDEVELOPING TWO FLOORS OF THE ST. MARY CORWIN HOSPITAL IN PUEBLO, COLORADO, TO ACCOMMODATE THE EXPANSION OF VOCATIONAL TRAINING PROGRAMS IN HEALTHCARE THAT WILL USED TO DEVELOP SPACE TO TRAIN ADDITIONAL HEALTHCARE WORKERS TO PREVENT, PREPARE FOR, AND RESPOND TO FUTURE CORONAVIRUS OUTBREAKS AND OTHER HEALTHCARE ISSUES.  THE HIGH NUMBERS OF COVID-19 CASES HAVE STRAINED PUEBLO’S TWO HOSPITALS HIGHLIGHTING THE NEED TO TRAIN ADDITIONAL NURSES TO MEET GROWING DEMAND AND STAFFING SHORTAGES.  THE TEACHING AND LEARNING CENTER AT ST. MARY CORWIN WILL ENABLE PCC TO PROVIDE MORE HEALTHCARE TRAINING THAT WILL PROVIDE ENTRY INTO A VARIETY OF OCCUPATIONAL PATHWAYS ADDRESSING STUDENT INTEREST WHILE ENSURING A PIPELINE INTO THE ARRAY OF HEALTH CARE JOBS AVAILABLE IN PUEBLO AND THE SURROUNDING REGION.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL HELP BOOST THE HEALTHCARE WORKFORCE SECTOR IN THE AREA, SAVE JOBS, SPUR PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND STRENGTHEN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE CITY OF MOUNTAIN GROVE WITH ADDRESSING THE LOCAL AND REGIONAL NEED FOR EXPANDING THEIR WATER AND SEWER SYSTEMS BY COMPLETING THE EXTENSION OF THEIR EXISTING MUNICIPAL POTABLE WATER AND SANITARY SYSTEM, WHICH WILL SERVICE AN AREA OF APPROXIMATELY 50 ACRES IN MOUNTAIN GROVE, MISSOURI.  THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE WATER AND WASTE FOR EXISTING BUSINESSES, LOCALLY OR NATIONAL EXPANDING BUSINESSES, OR NEW INDUSTRIES SEEKING TO LOCATE TO A WELL-ESTABLISHED FUNCTIONING SITE.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL CREATE JOBS, ATTRACT PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND ADVANCE ECONOMIC RESILIENCY THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE URBAN LEAGUE OF METROPOLITAN ST. LOUIS, INC. WITH CONSTRUCTING THE URBAN LEAGUE PLAZA AND INNOVATION CENTER, WHICH WILL OFFER SPACE AND BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT SERVICES TARGETING UNDER-SERVED MINORITY AND WOMEN ENTREPRENEURS IN THE REGION OF ST. LOUIS, MISSOURI.  THE CENTER WILL BE BOTH A WORKPLACE FOR UNDER-SERVED ENTREPRENEURS AND A SPACE FOR COLLABORATION AND EDUCATION.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL CREATE JOBS, ATTRACT PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND STRENGTHEN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE CITY OF WATERTOWN AND THE WATERTOWN DEVELOPMENT COMPANY WITH ADDRESSING THE REGIONAL NEED FOR ADDITIONAL INDUSTRIAL PARK SPACE BY CONSTRUCTING NECESSARY INFRASTRUCTURE TO CREATE SHOVEL-READY SITES AT A NEW 73-ACREE INDUSTRIAL PARK IN WATERTOWN, SOUTH DAKOTA.  THE PROJECT WORK INCLUDES EXCAVATING AND GRADING OF THE ENTIRE SITE, AND CONSTRUCTING A STORM SEWER, DETENTION PONDS, ROADWAY WITH CURB AND GUTTER, WATER MAIN AND MORE.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL HELP THE REGION RECOVER FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, CREATE JOBS AND BUSINESS OPPORTUNITIES, SPUR PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND ADVANCE ECONOMIC RESILIENCY THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS COLE COUNTY WITH DEVELOPING A MULTI-MODAL TRANSLOAD FACILITY AND ACCOMPANYING RAIL SPUR EXTENSION WITHIN THE ALGOA INDUSTRIAL PARK IN JEFFERSON CITY, MISSOURI.  THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE ACCESS TO RAIL SERVICE FOR REGIONAL INDUSTRIES THAT ARE NOT LOCATED ON RAIL SERVED SITES AND LOWER TRANSPORTATION COSTS FOR SHIPMENTS FOR MID-MISSOURI PRODUCERS AND CONSUMERS.  BY HARNESSING THE STRENGTHS OF BOTH THE RAIL INDUSTRY AND THE TRUCKING INDUSTRY AT A NEW MULTIMODAL FACILITY, THE REGION WILL HAVE A STRONGER AND MORE DIVERSIFIED TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM, WHICH WILL GENERATE AN ENVIRONMENT THAT CAN SERVE AS A CATALYST FOR UNPRECEDENTED REGIONAL ECONOMIC GROWTH.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS SOUTH SIOUX CITY WITH COMPLETING NECESSARY INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS FOR A BUSINESS SUBDIVISION, TO CREATE A MORE ECONOMICALLY COMPETITIVE REGION FOR SHIPPING AND LOGISTICS IN THE STATE OF NEBRASKA.  THE PROJECT WORK CONSISTS OF CONSTRUCTING APPROXIMATELY 1,550 LINEAR FEET OF CONCRETE PAVEMENT TO COMPLETE THE THOROUGHFARE OF COMMERCE WAY TO INTERSECT AND COMPLETE W 21ST.  THIS 'L' SHAPE STREET WILL COMPLETE THE STREET AND NECESSARY INFRASTRUCTURE (SANITARY SEWER, STORM SEWER, WATER MAIN) TO ALLOW LOTS 1-5; 7-12 TO BE SOLD AND DEVELOPED.  THE SIOUX CITY AREA IS AN IMPORTANT AGRICULTURAL PROCESSING AND SHIPPING CENTER, WHICH INCLUDES THE 8TH LARGEST LIVESTOCK PROCESSING CLUSTER IN THE US, ALONG WITH RELATED FOOD PROCESSING, ADVANCED MANUFACTURING, TRANSPORTATION, AND LOGISTICS. COMMERCE WAY BOLSTERS THE AREA'S TRANSPORTATION AND LOGISTICS CAPACITY, WHICH IS CRUCIAL AS LIVESTOCK PROCESSING CONTINUES TO ANCHOR THE REGIONAL ECONOMY.  ONCE COMPLETED, PROJECT WILL INCREASE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE COMMUNITY, SUPPORT THE FUTURE EXPANSION OF EXISTING COMPANIES, AND RECRUIT NEW INDUSTRIES INTO THE AREA, WHICH WILL ADVANCE ECONOMIC RESILIENCY THROUGHOUT THE REGION AND SPUR PRIVATE INVESTMENT.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE UTE MOUNTAIN UTE TRIBE'S LOCAL AND REGIONAL NEED FOR BROADBAND INFRASTRUCTURE BY CONSTRUCTING A MIDDLE MILE FIBER NETWORK TO SERVE THE BUSINESS CORRIDOR WITHIN THE CITY OF TOWAOC, A DESIGNATED OPPORTUNITY ZONE, AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES IN MONTEZUMA COUNTY, COLORADO.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE GROWTH OF EXISTING BUSINESSES, ENHANCE TELEMEDICINE OPPORTUNITIES, AND INCREASE EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES, WHICH WILL SUPPORT WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT, BOLSTER JOB CREATION, ATTRACT PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND ADVANCE ECONOMIC RESILIENCY THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT WILL LEVERAGE LOCAL FUNDS IN SIKESTON, MISSOURI TO SUPPORT DEVELOPMENT OF THE SOUTH INDUSTRIAL PARK. THE CITY OF SIKESTON AND THE SIKESTON BOARD OF MUNICIPAL UTILITIES ARE ADDRESSING THE LOCAL AND REGIONAL NEED FOR INDUSTRY GROWTH AND JOB CREATION IN THE AREA BY PROVIDING CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE TO THE SOUTH INDUSTRIAL PARK THAT WILL SUPPORT FUTURE TENANTS. THE ECONOMIC IMPACT WILL RESULT IN APPROXIMATELY 100 HIGH QUALITY JOBS AND OVER $61 MILLION IN PRIVATE INVESTMENT BEING CREATED. THIS PROJECT WAS MADE POSSIBLE BY THE REGIONAL PLANNING EFFORTS LED BY THE BOOTHEEL REGIONAL PLANNING AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION. EDA FUNDS THE BOOTHEEL PLANNING AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION TO BRING TOGETHER THE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SECTORS TO CREATE AN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ROADMAP TO STRENGTHEN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY, SUPPORT PRIVATE CAPITAL INVESTMENT AND CREATE JOBS.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE ALLEGHENY COUNTY AIRPORT AUTHORITY WITH EXPANDING THE CAPACITY OF IMPORT AND EXPORT OPERATIONS TO STIMULATE THE REGIONAL ECONOMY AND INCREASE THE ACCESS OF LOCAL COMMUNITIES TO EMPLOYMENT AND TRADE OPPORTUNITIES IN PITTSBURGH, PENNSYLVANIA.  THESE ADJUSTMENTS WILL ALLOW THE AIRPORT TO ACCOMMODATE THE EXPANSION OF GLOBAL AIR CARGO CARRIERS THUS INCREASING THE LOCAL SUPPLY OF AIR-CARRIED GOODS AND GENERATING NEW REAL ESTATE TAX REVENUE FOR THE LOCAL COMMUNITIES, WHICH NEED ECONOMIC STIMULUS.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE IMPROVEMENTS WILL HELP WITH RECOVERY EFFORTS FROM THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC BY RETAINING AND CREATING JOBS, SPURRING PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND ADVANCING ECONOMIC RESILIENCY THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT FUNDS THE EXTENSION OF WATER AND SEWER LINES FROM SWANTON VILLAGE ALONG AIRPORT ROAD TO THE FRANKLIN COUNTY AIRPORT AREA IN HIGHGATE CENTER, VERMONT.  THE PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF A 7-LOT INDUSTRIAL PARK ABUTTING THE AIRPORT, ADDITIONAL HANGARS FOR AIRCRAFT, AND A WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT FACILITY.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL CREATE JOBS, ATTRACT PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND ADVANCE ECONOMIC RESILIENCY THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE TOWN OF JAFFREY WITH CONSTRUCTING THE COLD STONE SPRINGS WATER SYSTEM PROJECT IN JAFFREY, NEW HAMPSHIRE.  THE PROJECT INCLUDES CONSTRUCTION OF A WATER TREATMENT PLANT AND TRANSMISSION LINES TO PROVIDE SUFFICIENT QUALITY AND QUANTITY OF WATER IN SUPPORT MANUFACTURING OPERATIONS.  IN ADDITION, THE PROJECT WILL INCREASE THE CAPACITY AND TREATMENT LEVEL OF JAFFREY'S PUBLIC WATER SUPPLY SYSTEM, WHICH WILL ALLOW MILLIPORESIGMA, A LARGE MANUFACTURER LOCATED IN JAFFREY THAT EMPLOYS OVER 1,000 PEOPLE, TO PURCHASE NEW EQUIPMENT, UPGRADE ITS FACILITY, AND HIRE NEW EMPLOYEES.  THIS COMPANY'S PRODUCTS ARE USED IN VACCINE AND SERUM PRODUCTION TO PREVENT AND TREAT COVID.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL GENERATE AN ENVIRONMENT THAT CAN SERVE AS A CATALYST FOR UNPRECEDENTED REGIONAL ECONOMIC GROWTH.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE BRUNSWICK COUNTY INDUSTRIAL DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY WITH THE CONSTRUCTION OF AN APPROXIMATELY 47,000 SF BUILDING WITH PARKING AND SITE WORK, TO FUNCTION AS A LARGE-SCALE PRODUCE PROCESSING AND DISTRIBUTION FACILITY.  THE FACILITY WILL ALLOW NUMEROUS LOCAL FARMERS TO SCALE UP THEIR FARM PRODUCTION TO MEET MARKET DEMAND IN BRUNSWICK COUNTY, VIRGINIA.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL ATTRACT PRIVATE INVESTMENT, BOLSTER JOB CREATION, STIMULATE ECONOMIC RESILIENCE AND LONG-TERM RECOVERY, AND STRENGTHEN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE BOROUGH OF PAULSBORO WITH EXPANDING THE TREATMENT CAPACITY OF THE PAULSBORO WATER TREATMENT PLANT, GAINING AN ADDITIONAL 1,000GPM OF TREATMENT CAPACITY FOR A TOTAL OF 2,500GPM.  THE CAPACITY INCREASE WILL ALLOW THE BOROUGH FULL USE OF THEIR WATER ALLOCATION FOR THE THREE WELLS, WHICH WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT COMMERCIAL AND INDUSTRIAL DEVELOPMENT WITHIN THE BOROUGH.  THE PROJECT WILL ALSO INCLUDE CONSTRUCTION OF A 6,000 SF BUILDING TO CONTAIN THE NEW WATER TREATMENT SYSTEM.  THE INCREASED CAPACITY WILL SERVE A NEW MANUFACTURING FACILITY TO BUILD STEEL COMPONENTS, KNOWN AS MONOPILES, FOR OFFSHORE WIND TURBINES THAT WILL SERVE THE ENTIRE UNITED STATES OFFSHORE WIND INDUSTRY.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL INCREASE BUSINESS GROWTH AND DEVELOPMENT, BOLSTER JOB CREATION AND RETENTION, SPUR PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND ADVANCE ECONOMIC RESILIENCY THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE MIFFLIN COUNTY ACADEMY OF SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY WITH CONSTRUCTING FACILITIES TO TRAIN DIESEL MECHANICS AND HEAVY EQUIPMENT OPERATORS TO FILL THE DEMAND GAP FOR SKILLED WORKERS IN CENTRAL PENNSYLVANIA.  THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE A SPACE TO ESTABLISH A PROGRAM THAT IS UNIQUE TO THE REGION, PROVIDING CERTIFICATION OPPORTUNITIES TO BOTH SECONDARY AND POST-SECONDARY LEARNERS, WHICH WILL ENABLE RESIDENTS TO ENTER THE WORKFORCE WITH CORE CAPABILITIES AND TECHNICAL SKILLS.  THE TRAINING IS ALSO ESSENTIAL TO FILL BOTH THE EXISTING AND ANTICIPATED DEMANDS FROM NEW INDUSTRIAL PARKS IN DEVELOPMENT WITHIN THE COMMUTING AREA.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL HELP CREATE AND SAVE JOBS, WHICH WILL ADVANCE ECONOMIC RESILIENCY THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS KING AND QUEEN COUNTY WITH CONSTRUCTING A MULTI-TENANT BUILDING TO HOUSE A TELEWORK CENTER, TELEHEALTH CENTER AND THE MIDDLE PENINSULA PLANNING DISTRICT COMMISSION OFFICES IN A DESIGNATED OPPORTUNITY ZONE IN VIRGINIA.  THE PROJECT ADDRESSES THE PRESSING NEED FOR MEDICAL SERVICES AS WELL AS PROVIDING A TELEWORK/BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT FACILITY IN THE COUNTY.  AT STARTUP, THE PROPOSED FACILITY WOULD HOUSE A FULL-TIME NURSE, ONE OR TWO PHYSICAL THERAPISTS AND REVOLVING PHYSICIANS UTILIZING THREE EXAM ROOMS AND NECESSARY SUPPORT FACILITIES.  IN ADDITION, THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE THE FACILITIES WITH HIGH-SPEED INTERNET SERVICE.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL SERVE AS A CRITICAL ANCHOR FOR MEDICAL SERVICES AND BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT IN THE AREA, WHICH WILL ATTRACT PRIVATE INVESTMENT, CREATE JOBS THROUGHOUT THE REGION, AND PROVIDE LONG-TERM SUSTAINABLE ECONOMIC GROWTH.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE MASSACHUSETTS DEVELOPMENT FINANCE AGENCY WITH CONSTRUCTING AN INDUSTRIAL ACCESS ROAD AND MAKING STORMWATER INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS TO SERVE BUSINESSES LOCATED WITHIN THE DEVENS INDUSTRIAL AREA AND FORMER FORT DEVENS MILITARY BASE IN AYER, MA, A REGIONAL JOB CENTER THAT PROVIDES HIGH WAGE JOB OPPORTUNITIES IN ADVANCED MANUFACTURING AND BIOTECHNOLOGY, TO THE RESIDENTS OF THE MONTACHUSETT GREATER LOWELL REGION.  THE REDEVELOPMENT OF THE ACCESS ROAD WILL PROMOTE FUTURE PRIVATE INVESTMENT AND INDUSTRY EXPANSIONS, BOLSTER JOB CREATION, AND STRENGTHEN RESILIENCY WITHIN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY.

THIS INVESTMENT WILL SUPPORT THE TOWN OF VINALHAVEN'S CRITICAL LOBSTER FISHING AND TOURISM INDUSTRIES BY IMPROVING THE FLOOD RESILIENCE OF ITS DOWNTOWN COMMERCIAL DISTRICT THROUGH UPGRADED STORMWATER MANAGEMENT INFRASTRUCTURE, THE IMPROVEMENT OF  DEFICIENT AND VULNERABLE SEWER AND WATER UTILITIES, AND IMPROVEMENT OF PEDESTRIAN AND VEHICULAR TRANSPORTATION INFRASTRUCTURE.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE ACQUISITION AND INSTALLATION OF TWO NEW ELECTRIC RUBBER-TIRED GANTRY (ERTG) CRANES, INCLUDING THE COST OF INFRASTRUCTURE UPGRADES. THESE CRANES ARE UNIQUELY DESIGNED TO HAVE THE CAPABILITY OF REACHING THE FAR SIDE OF A SHIPPING VESSEL TO OFFLOAD CARGO, RATHER THAN THE VESSEL HAVING TO TURN AROUND IN PORT. THIS RESULTS IN GREATLY REDUCED LOADING AND OFFLOADING TIME. THE TIME SAVED FROM THIS DESIGN ADVANTAGE MAKES THEM EXCEPTIONALLY EFFICIENT TOOLS FOR OFFLOADING CONTAINERIZED CARGO, WHICH REPRESENTS OVER 98% OF THE CARGO THAT PASSES THROUGH THE PAMT.

THIS PROJECT IS SUPPORTED BY THE DELAWARE VALLEY REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION (DVRPC).

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE TOWN OF BOYDTON WITH MAKING IMPROVEMENTS TO THE BOYDTON WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANT AND A SEWER LINE FROM THE PLANT TO SERVICE AN EXPANDING MICROSOFT DATA CENTER CAMPUS IN MECKLENBURG COUNTY, VIRGINIA.  THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE THE WASTEWATER INFRASTRUCTURE CAPACITY NEEDED TO BRING NEW BUSINESSES AND JOBS TO THE COMMUNITY, WHICH WILL HELP ADDRESS THE PRESSING NEED FOR EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES IN A REGION THAT WAS DEVASTATED BY THE DECLINE OF THE FURNITURE AND TOBACCO INDUSTRIES.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL ADVANCE THE REGION'S MANUFACTURING INDUSTRY, CREATE JOBS, SPUR PRIVATE INVESTMENT, AND STRENGTHEN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY.

THE CITY OF HORNELL INDUSTRIAL DEVELOPMENT AGENCY AND CITY OF HORNELL WILL UNDERTAKE INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS AT THE SHAWMUT INDUSTRIAL PARK IN ORDER TO FACILITATE ALSTOM'S CONSTRUCTION OF A NEW CAR BODY SHELL MANUFACTURING FACILITY.   WORK INCLUDES:  2,800 LINEAR FEET OF SHAWMUT PARK DRIVE WILL BE MILLED AND DETERIORATED PAVEMENT RESTORED TO SUPPORT NEW TRAFFIC TO NYS ROUTE 36; TRAFFIC CONTROL SIGNALS AND OVERHEAD UTILITY LINES WILL BE RELOCATED AND OVERHANGING TREES REMOVED.ALONG THACHER STREET ROAD TO ACCOMMODATE VEHICLES CARRYING CAR BODY SHELLS;  CONSTRUCTION OF TWO PARKING AREAS WITH LIGHTING, PAVEMENT, TRAFFIC CONTROL AND STORMWATER FEATURES; RELOCATION AND REPLACEMENT OF 750 LINEAL FEET OF 20 INCH WATER MAIN; RELOCATION AND REPLACEMENT OF 1,750 LINEAL FEET OF 12 INCH SANITARY SEWER; AND UPGRADE OF A SEWER PUMP STATION.

THIS INVESTMENT WILL SUPPORT THE GROWTH OF THE TECHPLACE MANUFACTURING CENTER BY INSTALLING COOLING SYSTEMS THAT WILL PROVIDING A YEAR-ROUND CONTROLLED CLIMATE THAT IS ESSENTIAL TO HIGH TECHNOLOGY PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT AND MANUFACTURING OPERATIONS. THE PROJECT WILL SERVE THE CENTER'S OFFICES AND  30,000 SQUARE FEET OF MANUFACTURING SPACE AND INCLUDE THE INSTALLATION OF LIGHTING CONTROLS TO MAXIMIZE ENERGY EFFICIENCY.

THIS EDA INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE CONSTRUCTION OF A 16,000 SQ FT. MULTI-TENANT BUILDING ON A 15-ACRE PARCEL TO PROVIDE SPACE TO PRIVATE COMPANIES AT THE HANGARS TECHNOLOGY PARK (FORMERLY KNOWN AS TECH VILLAGE) AT THE CAPE MAY COUNTY AIRPORT.  THE PROJECT WORK INCLUDES SITE LABOR, PARKING, LIGHTING, SIDEWALKS, AND EXPANSION OF STORMWATER FACILITIES.  ONCE COMPLETED, THE PROJECT WILL BOOST GROWTH IN THE AVIATION TECHNOLOGY CLUSTER BY PROVIDING SPACE FOR TWO TECHNOLOGY COMPANIES, WHICH WILL SPUR PRIVATE INVESTMENT AND ADVANCE ECONOMIC RESILIENCY THROUGHOUT THE REGION.

THE BASE EDA INVESTMENT WILL REPAIR CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE SERVING THE TOWN OF SEABROOK'S COMMERCIAL FISHING AND HOSPITALITY INDUSTRIES AND AT THE NEXTERA NUCLEAR POWER STATION SAVING APPROXIMATELY 200 JOBS. THE PROJECT INVOLVES THE REPLACEMENT OF APPROXIMATELY 550 LINEAR FEET OF STEEL SHEET PILE AND RELATED TIMBER FENDERING ON THE EXISTING BULKHEAD, AND THE RE-GRADING AND PAVING OF THE LAND BEHIND THE FAILING SEAWALL. THIS AMENDMENT ADDS FUNDING FOR REPAIRS TO THE SOUTH BULKHEAD WALL WHICH WAS FOUND TO BE COMPROMISED, ADDITIONAL PERMITTING COSTS RESULTING FROM THE COMPROMISED BULKHEAD WALL, AND A U.S. FISH & WILDLIFE RESTRICTION LIMITING THE CONSTRUCTION SEASON TO THE MORE EXPENSIVE WINTER MONTHS OF NOVEMBER 15 - MARCH 15.
